quizName: Windchill Advanced BOM Transformation and MPMLink
description: 100-question quiz generated from the WCBM-ABTT training guide (BOM Transformer, Smart Collections, Control Characteristics, Process Plans, Work Instructions)

questions.text: What is the primary goal when transforming an eBOM to an mBOM in Windchill MPMLink?
options: Rename all engineering parts for compliance
Merge multiple CAD models into one file
Align the manufacturing view with how the product is intended to be built

questions.text: Which action reuses an engineering part directly in the downstream mBOM?
Which tool helps maintain associative links between eBOM and mBOM parts?
Which view represents the manufacturing perspective of how a product will be built?
Which action is NOT listed as a method for transforming eBOM into mBOM?
Which Windchill capability enables design and manufacturing teams to modify their BOMs while staying in sync?
What does the Split Assemblies action enable you to do in BOM Transformer?
options: Create and manage multiple downstream assemblies from an upstream part

questions.text: Where do you initiate creation of split assemblies when the upstream part is selected?
In a split assembly scenario, how are quantities handled downstream?
options: Occur in different downstream assemblies with their own quantities

questions.text: Which attribute must be set correctly when creating split assemblies to place objects in the right location?
What panel icon should you use after finishing split assembly creation to view results?
What is a practical use of split assemblies?
options: Manage consumption of child parts across multiple manufacturing assemblies

questions.text: What does the Assemble action in BOM Transformer create?
Alternate assemblies created by Assemble are described as…
Which example illustrates Assemble usage?
options: Create car seat fabric variants like Nylon, Leather, Polyester, Vinyl

questions.text: Where do you start Assemble for a selected upstream component?
When using Assemble, which type is typically chosen for new objects?
Which middle-pane actions improve detection and resolution of BOM changes?
After detecting discrepancies, what action propagates upstream changes to the downstream structure?
Which status may appear when top-level structures are out of sync after changes?
What downstream command updates to the current upstream equivalent object?
options: Update to Current Upstream Equivalent Object

questions.text: Where are impacted components highlighted during discrepancy review?
Which filter helps find control characteristic differences in BOM Transformer?
options: Control Characteristics filter in Propagate Upstream Changes

questions.text: Which consumption indicator signifies a part has been used more times downstream than upstream allows?
Which indicator means downstream consumption is less than upstream usage?
What does 'Unknown consumption' indicate?
options: Equivalent usage exists but consumption status is unknown

questions.text: Where do you assess equivalent usage and status indicators?
options: In BOM Transformer with status icons

questions.text: Which action refreshes indicator status after resolving occurrences?
What is an equivalent occurrence?
options: A manually created link between child occurrence paths of equivalent parent parts

questions.text: What prerequisite enables creation of equivalent occurrence links?
options: Allow Editing Navigation Criteria set to Yes
Auto Part Allocation set to Yes
Latest Iteration On Revise set to Yes

questions.text: To create an equivalent occurrence link, you must select…
options: An equivalent part upstream and an equivalent part downstream

questions.text: Which toolbar command creates the occurrence link?
What tab visualizes the occurrence link graphically?
What happens after creating an equivalent occurrence?
Equivalent occurrences help monitor discrepancies at which level?
options: Occurrence level between downstream and upstream BOMs

questions.text: Which preference auto-creates occurrences when inserting new usages?
options: Automatically Create Occurrences for New Usages
Show Full Creo View in Illustration Editor

questions.text: What does 'Prevent Over Consumption of Occurrences Downstream' do when set to Yes?
options: Prevents consuming upstream occurrences already consumed downstream

questions.text: Where are site-wide occurrence preferences configured?
Which user action selects equivalent occurrences on the other side?
options: Right-click an occurrence and choose 'Select Equivalent Occurrences on Other Side'

questions.text: Which structure view customization brings Reference Designators forward in the table?
options: Add 'Reference Designator' column and move it up

questions.text: What is a Smart Collection used for?
options: Divide complex structures into cohesive chunks for transformation and planning

questions.text: Where can you open a Smart Collection from?
options: Folder view, Information page, or search results

questions.text: Which middle-panel command starts creating a Smart Collection?
Which attributes are set when creating a Smart Collection?
What table column can mark objects likely to have use/value?
Where is the Smart Collection icon located when editing in BOM Transformer?
Which step lets you copy/paste part path info while editing a Smart Collection?
What are control characteristics?
options: Functional features or properties needing variation/deviation control

questions.text: Where are standard control characteristics created?
options: Actions menu on a Product context folder (MPMLink only)

questions.text: Which attributes are REQUIRED when creating a control characteristic?
Which attribute may be auto-generated depending on configuration?
Which are valid control characteristic categories?
options: Examples include Angularity, Circularity, Flatness, Position

questions.text: Which tab must be added to manage CC representations and annotations?
Which objects can be associated with a standard control characteristic?
options: Reference documents, standard procedures, processing resources

questions.text: Which attributes are editable after checking out a control characteristic?
options: Description, Long Description, Nominal Value, Upper/Lower Limits

questions.text: Where in BOM Transformer do you manage CCs for a selected part?
Which CAD application step can designate annotations as control characteristics?
options: Creo Parametric Annotation Feature with Designate and Control Characteristic

questions.text: How do you insert an EXISTING control characteristic in BOM Transformer?
options: Use Insert Existing on the CC tab and Add Existing dialog

questions.text: How do you insert a NEW control characteristic in BOM Transformer?
options: Use Insert New on the CC tab to open New Standard Control Characteristics

questions.text: How do you remove a standard control characteristic?
options: Select it and use Remove icon or right-click Remove Standard Control Characteristic

questions.text: Which panel detects Out Of Date changes including Added Control Characteristic?
Before running discrepancy searches for CCs, you must…
options: Select a part in the upstream view

questions.text: Which tab shows CCs uploaded from CAD into the upstream part?
options: Control Characteristics tab in BOM Transformer

questions.text: What is extended data in Windchill?
options: A versioned workable object storing data for ERP publishing

questions.text: Extended data can be associated to parts regardless of…
Which types of extended data does the system manage?
Enterprise data is shared across…
options: All revisions and iterations of a part master

questions.text: Plant data is shared across…
options: All revisions and iterations of a particular view of a part

questions.text: Which page aggregates information and actions for extended data?
What does a process plan provide?
options: Step-by-step instructions to produce, inspect, repair, or maintain

questions.text: In ERP terminology, a process plan is most often called a…
Which element represents the core manufacturing step?
Which type groups operations in regular succession?
Which statement about standard procedures is TRUE?
options: They can be associated to parts
They are referenced within process plans and propagate changes
They must be in Design view

questions.text: Which PPB tabs show allocated parts and resources?
Which PPB preference defaults to YES?
options: Automatic Check In Operations and Sequences

questions.text: Which PPB preference defaults to NO?
options: Show Standard CC Allocations on Tree
Load The Structure in Visualization Tab On Demand

questions.text: Which two methods can create a process plan?
options: Folder Actions > New Process Plan and BOM Transformer > Insert New

questions.text: Which tab displays an operation’s long description for editing?
Which command inserts multiple operations as sub-operations when right-clicking an operation?
Which command inserts operations within an existing set after a selected one?
Which dialog is used to create a sequence or subsequence?
Where are standard procedures created and maintained?
Which command lets you copy operations from existing plans/templates?
How do you rename multiple operations quickly?
options: Select them in Uses tab and use Rename Operations

questions.text: Which fields often store task times for operations?
options: Plan Time, CAD Time, Publish Time
Issue Time, Review Time, Approval Time
Start Time, End Time, Cycle State
Setup Time, Labor Time, Processing Time

questions.text: Which attribute enables occurrence allocation from subassemblies (test-only)?
options: Latest Iteration On Revise set to Yes
Allow Editing Navigation Criteria set to Yes
Occurrence Allocation From Any Level set to Yes
Auto Part Allocation set to Yes

questions.text: Where do you allocate BOM parts to operations?
Which two ways allocate parts in PPB?
options: Drag-and-drop from Tree Picker or use Allocate to Operation

questions.text: What happens to part images in Tree Picker after allocation?
options: They display as phantom/transparent or are hidden based on options

questions.text: Which icon displays allocation percentage in Tree Picker?
Which allocation type references parts outside the BOM used by an operation?
Why can the same part usage not be allocated to more than one operation (without parallel sequence)?
options: Because allocation signifies the component is now assembled and cannot be assembled again

questions.text: In MPMLink, work instructions are delivered as…
Which sizes are available when printing work instructions?
Which methods create illustrations for operations?
options: Creo View annotations, Operation Illustration Editor, or associated documents

questions.text: What must exist before illustrations can be created for an operation?
options: A default representation of the operation

questions.text: Which playback action step creates the default representation?
options: Click New Representation in Playback Actions

questions.text: Where can you monitor successful publish jobs for representations?
What does the Process Plan 'Play' function do?
options: Plays the assembly procedure, turning parts transparent as used
